intro: Ixoca alpestris, commonly known as the alpine ixora, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
